title: Present Perfect - Simple or Continuous
instructions: Complete the sentences with the alternative that best completes the sentence.

sentence: there in the rain for an hour.
remarks: Corr: has been standing. No quantity, no stative verb.
C
Corr: have been dancing. No quantity, no stative verb.
C

sentence: each other for only 2 years, yet we're very good friends.
remarks: C
Corr: have known. The verb 'know' is a stative verb, it's not used in the continuous.
C
Corr: have had. If the verb 'have' expresses possession, we cannot use it in the continuous.
